Name.BusinessNameLine1: Optimist Boys' Home and Ranch Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Optimist Boys Home and Ranch, Inc. is a private, not-for-profit corporation that provides residential care, transitional housing, foster care, adoptions, special education and mental health programs for troubled and disadvantaged youth.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Optimist Boys Home and Ranch, Inc.'s mission is to provide culturally sensitive comprehensive treatment, specialized education and support services to abused, neglected or at-risk children, youth and their families to establish stability within families and communities.
IRS990.Description: RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT provides residential care and day treatment to approximately 415 troubled and disadvantaged youths at one main campus and four group homes. During the year covered, this program provided 41,826 days of care.

Activity2.Description: The FOSTER FAMILY AGENCY provides quality foster care for approximately 220 abused, abandoned, and neglected children, ages birth to 17 years. During the year covered, this program made placements and provided 30,300 days of care.

Activity3.Description: OPTIMIST SCHOOL is a non-public high school for students with learning disabilities and/or emotional problems. During the year covered, the school averaged just over 115 students.

ActivityOther.Description: The MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAM provides day treatment and rehabilitation for men and women in the community and clients of the other programs. Clients received special education, intensive family counseling, sexual offender groups, art and movement therapy, substance abuse services, socialization skills, intensive psychotherapy, vocational assessments, and psychiatric support.During the year covered, 449 clients were served.

TRANSITIONAL HOUSING- The Transitional Housing Program began in November 2007 and our contract is with Riverside County Department of Public Social Services. We provide services to transitional age youth from the ages of 18 to 24 years, The goal of the program is to assist former foster youth in securing and maintaning housing while they seek employment, education or other self-sufficiency sustaning tasks. The number of youth we serve is currently 43.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: Our NPS is state certified and follows all the rules of the California public school system.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The organization receives fees and government contracts for Residential board and care, mental health services, foster care, nutrition program, transitional housing and adoption assistance.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.DescriptionOfNonCashAssistance: Residential care including therapies such as sexual offender groups, art therapy and movement therapy. In addition, this program provides additional substance abuse services, socialization skills, intensive psychotherapy, vocational assessments, and psychiatric support.
on-going support to foster children and families including regular visits, comprehensive treatment plans, monthly reports, and referrals.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The organization maintains records to substantiate the amount of assistance and the selection criteria used to award the assistance.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Finance Committee of the Board of Directors reviews the 990 before it is filed with the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The conflict of interest policy was signed by each Board member and is reviewed at a Board meeting annually. It requires every Board member to disclose any conflicts in writing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Committee of the Board of Directors meets annually to review the compensation of the Executive Director to deicde on a merit increase and to determine if the salary remains fair and reasonable using comparability data. Other officers or key employees salaries are reviewed annually by the Executive Director and the Human Resources Director to determine if the salary remains fair and reasonable using salary data gathered from similar not-for-profit agencies.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization provides the governance policies, Form 990 and financial statements upon request.
